data.enText: a heavy metal object that is attached to a rope or chain and dropped over the side of a ship or boat to keep it in one place

data.chText: 船在离岩岸两英里处抛锚停泊。
data.enText: The ship lay at anchor two miles off the rocky coast.
We weighed anchor (= pulled it out of the water) .

data.chText: 给以安全感的人（或物）；精神支柱；顶梁柱
data.enText: a person or thing that gives sb a feeling of safety
to let an anchor down from a boat or ship in order to prevent it from moving away

data.chText: 我们在西班牙沿海抛锚停泊。
data.enText: We anchored off the coast of Spain.
to fix sth firmly in position so that it cannot move
Make sure the table is securely anchored.
to firmly base sth on sth else

data.chText: 她的小说取材自日常生活经验。
data.enText: Her novels are anchored in everyday experience.
to be the person who introduces reports or reads the news on television or radio

data.chText: 她主持了七年晚间新闻报道。
data.enText: She anchored the evening news for seven years.

tr: a mechanical device that prevents a vessel from moving
a central cohesive source of support and stability
example: the keystone of campaign reform was the ban on soft money
he is the linchpin of this firm

tr: a television reporter who coordinates a broadcast to which several correspondents contribute
secure a vessel with an anchor

value.def: An anchor is a heavy hooked object that is dropped from a boat into the water at the end of a chain in order to make the boat stay in one place.
When a boat anchors or when you anchor it, its anchor is dropped into the water in order to make it stay in one place.

example.ex: We could anchor off the pier...
example.tran: 我们可以在码头附近下锚停泊。

value.def: If you anchor an object somewhere, you fix it to something to prevent it moving from that place.

example.ex: The roots anchor the plant in the earth...
example.tran: 根部使植物固定在土壤中。

example.ex: The child seat belt was not properly anchored to the car.
example.tran: 儿童坐椅的安全带并未在车上固定到位。

value.def: If one thing is the anchor for something else, it makes that thing stable and secure.

example.ex: He provided an emotional anchor for her...
He remains the anchor of the country's fragile political balance.
example.tran: 他仍然是维系该国脆弱的政治平衡的支柱。

value.tran: 固定桩；系缚物；支柱；靠山

value.def: If something is anchored in something or to something, it has strong links with it.

example.ex: A united Germany must be firmly anchored in NATO if Europe is to remain stable...
example.tran: 欧洲要保持稳定，德国必须统一并固守北约。

example.ex: His basic outlook remains anchored in the liberal tradition.
example.tran: 他的基本观念依旧扎根于自由主义传统。

value.tran: 与…有紧密联系;使扎根;使固守

value.def: The person who anchors a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the person who presents it and acts as a link between interviews and reports which come from other places or studios.

example.ex: Viewers saw him anchoring a five-minute summary of regional news.
example.tran: 观众看见他主持一个5分钟的地方新闻摘要节目。

example.ex: ...a series of cassettes on the Vietnam War, anchored by Mr. Cronkite.
example.tran: 克朗凯特先生主持的关于越南战争的系列节目录像带

value.tran: 主持（电视或电台节目，尤指新闻节目）

value.def: The anchor on a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the person who presents it.

example.ex: He worked in the news division of ABC — he was the anchor of its 15-minute evening newscast.
example.tran: 他在美国广播公司的新闻部工作——他是晚间15分钟新闻播报的主持人。

value.tran: （尤指新闻节目的）电（视）台节目主持人

value.def: If a boat is at anchor, it is floating in a particular place and is prevented from moving by its anchor.

example.ex: Sailing boats lay at anchor in the narrow waterway.
example.tran: 帆船停泊在狭窄的水道上。

value.def: When the people on a boat drop anchor or cast anchor, they drop the boat's anchor into the water in order to prevent the boat from moving.

example.ex: We dropped anchor in a sheltered spot.
example.tran: 我们在一个能够遮风挡雨的地方下了锚。

value.def: When the people on a boat weigh anchor or up anchor, they pull the anchor of the boat out of the water so that they can sail away.

trans: 地脚螺栓；锚螺栓；底座螺柱
